description: In Israel’s south and north, neighborhoods are still front lines. Survivors and evacuees feel the world doesn’t understand their sense of vulnerability.
title: Six months after Oct. 7, Israel’s borderlands are frozen in time — and fear

description: U.S. troops bound for the Gaza coast are due to arrive in the eastern Mediterranean within days, but complications have cast uncertainty over the operation.
title: U.S. scrambles to finalize Gaza pier plans as famine looms

description:
Reopening the Erez crossing could help the flow of aid into hunger-stricken northern Gaza. Before the war, it was primarily 
used for foot traffic.
title: Why Israel may reopen a key crossing with Gaza

description: Many capitals are anxious about Donald Trump’s potential return to the White House, but it’s particularly acute in Japan, which prizes predictability (and loves a snappy phrase).
title: ‘If Trump’: Japan readies for the return of a quixotic American president

description: Food sources are dwindling in the Canadian lagoon where the 2-year-old killer whale, named by local First Nations people, has been stranded since last month.
title: Rescuers scramble to save orphaned orca calf dubbed ‘Brave Little Hunter’

description: Ecuadorian police forced their way into Mexico’s embassy in Quito and arrested former Ecuadorian vice president Jorge Glas, who had sought asylum there.
title: Mexico breaks relations with Ecuador after embassy raid

description: President Biden wrote to the leaders of Egypt and Qatar urging them to push Hamas to commit to a cease-fire and hostage release deal, a White House official said.
title: Blinken says ‘real test is results’ after Israel announces Gaza aid routes

description: Pessimism about Ukraine’s battlefield chances has increased in recent months as Russian forces have regained the initiative on the battlefield, largely because Ukrainians are short on troops and ammunition.
title: With no way out of a worsening war, Zelensky’s options look bad or worse

description: The strike highlighted what aid workers say is a faulty process for deconflicting humanitarian operations with the Israeli military in Gaza.
title: Before WCK strike, aid groups had warned of peril to Gaza relief workers
